text: Anna Karabessini (; 12 June 1923 – 7 September 2018), was a Greek singer- songwriter of traditional and folk music.Κράτησε ψηλά τη σημαία της παράδοσης Born in Antimachia, Kos, from her early age her talent in singing appeared as her parents engaged in music and singing. Together with her sister Efi Sarris, they sang traditional songs for many years and are considered "having a prominent position and well known among all those who served the musical tradition of Kos and the Dodecanese"Άννα Καραμπεσίνη-Σαρρή, Ελευθερία Αρβανιτάκη και άλλα... Πηγή: www.musicpaper.gr Πέθανε η τραγουδίστρια Άννα Καραμπεσίνη She moved to Athens in 1947 with her sister Eftyhia. In 1949 he met and married Charalambos Karabessin and lived together for 35 years until 1984 when he died. In Athens in the early 1950s, her meeting with Simon Karas was decisive for Anna's later artistic career. In 1952 she returns to Kos for business trips to Athens for recordings songs. Anna, accompanied by her sister Eustachia, recorded 23 recordings.Άννα Καραμπεσίνη Discography Anna and Eftychia, apart from the albums, took part in many TV shows as well as in programs of Hellenic Broadcasting Corporation."Η Μούσα του Αιγαίου": ΄Αννα Σαρρή - Καραμπεσίνη She performed in United States, Canada and Australia. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2018 deaths Category:People from Kos Category:Greek singer-songwriters Category:Greek folk singers Category:Greek female singers Category:20th-century Greek singers Category:21st-century Greek singers Category:20th-century women singers Category:21st-century women singers
title: Anna Karabessini
